author: Daisy Mowke
content: Singer Zubeen Garg, known for singing Ya Ali song from 'Gangster', has been admitted to a private hospital in Assam. The singer was admitted to the hospital after he sustained a head injury. Zubeen was reportedly in a resort in Dibrugarh when he slipped in the bathroom. Doctors revealed that he had a seizure following an epileptic fit, said reports.
title: 'Ya Ali' singer Zubeen Garg hospitalised due to head injury after falling in bathroom

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Mahesh Bhatt, coming out in support of Sushmita Sen who recently announced she's dating Lalit Modi, also shared how she met her former partner Vikram Bhatt. "During the making of 'Dastak', Vikram's romance with Sushmita started in Seychelles," he stated. "Vikram was my right hand...doing most of my work. So, he used to interact with her more vigorously," Bhatt added.
title: Vikram Bhatt's romance with Sushmita started during 'Dastak' making in Seychelles: Mahesh

author: Arshiya Chopra
content: Kareena Kapoor took to Instagram to deny the rumours claiming she's pregnant for the third time after a picture of her and Saif Ali Khan from their Europe vacation went viral. "It's the pasta and wine guys...calm down...I am not pregnant.. uff...Saif says he has already contributed way too much to the population of our country...enjoy...KKK," she wrote on Instagram.
title: Kareena denies pregnancy rumours, says 'Saif has contributed way too much to population'

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Kartik Aaryan has said when he first joined Bollywood, he didn't have any car. "The first car...I bought was after a couple of films, a third-hand car...for around ₹60,000," he stated. "I took it specifically because I was still taking an auto to the red carpet, or going on a bike, or getting a lift," he added.
title: I bought a third-hand car for ₹60,000 after first few films: Kartik Aaryan

author: Sakshita Khosla
content: Renowned Punjabi lyricist and music composer Jaani Johan was hospitalised after being injured in a road accident in Mohali on Tuesday. As per reports, 33-year-old Jaani and two others were travelling in an SUV which hit another car and both vehicles flipped after the collision. A pic has shown the 'Pachtaoge' and 'Filhall' lyricist's SUV lying overturned on the road.
title: Lyricist Jaani injured in accident in Punjab, pic of his overturned SUV surfaces

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt, speaking about Sushmita Sen, told ETimes, "She has the guts to live on her own dictates." "My personal belief is that we must in the second decade of...21st century give human beings...right to live life on their own terms," he added. Sushmita recently announced that she is dating Lalit Modi.
title: In 21st century, we must give people right to live life on own terms: Mahesh on Sushmita

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Ranbir Kapoor revealed his late father Rishi Kapoor wasn't happy with his film choices and added his father was happy when Ranbir joined 'Shamshera'. As per Rishi, Ranbir's film choices were "bakwaas (nonsense)" and didn't feature in films for the masses. "Unfortunately, he hadn't seen the trailer or poster of 'Shamshera', but I know...he's somewhere out there, proud," Ranbir added.
title: Dad Rishi Kapoor called my film choices 'nonsense': Ranbir Kapoor

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Following the success of his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', actor Kartik Aaryan said, "My producers told me recently, 'You're...an actor who doubles our money in 25 days'." Discussing his struggling days in Bollywood, Kartik stated, "[My] first car...was...a third-hand car...I got it with great difficulty...I took it specifically because I was still taking an auto to the red carpet."
title: My producers tell me 'You double our money in 25 days': Kartik Aaryan

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Prince Narula, speaking about his chance in Bollywood, has said, "They (producers) have...many star kids to launch that we don't know if we will ever get a chance." "Even if we get a role, it'll be...some other (side) role," he added. Prince stated that while getting into Bollywood is hard, people's perception has changed after Sushant Singh Rajput's death.
title: Producers have star kids to launch, don't know if we'll get chance: Prince

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actor Anupam Kher posted a video on Instagram, in which he spoke about R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. In the video, Anupam said, "Thank you Madhavan for making such a brilliant film. If the film can inspire me, it will surely inspire today's generation." He captioned the post, "Cried my heart out. Every Indian should watch it!"
title: Cried my heart out, every Indian should watch it: Anupam on 'Rocketry...'

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt defended Sushmita Sen after she was trolled over her relationship with Lalit Modi. "What I salute her for is that she has lived her life on her own terms," he stated. "My...belief is that we must in the second decade of the 21st century give human beings the right to live life on their...terms," he added.
title: I salute Sushmita Sen for living life on her own terms: Mahesh Bhatt

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Talking about Jackie Chan, Mallika Sherawat said, "Jackie Chan is like an older brother to me....He opened all the doors for me in Hollywood." She added Jackie helped her settle in Hollywood after things went bad for her in Bollywood. "Jackie said...'You just land there in LA and you'll get the red carpet treatment', and I did," she stated.
title: Jackie Chan opened doors for me in H'wood, he's like older brother: Mallika

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Discussing his national language debate on Twitter with Ajay Devgn, Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeep said, "I am...sure the man I know would never tweet in Hindi." "It's definitely a third person's idea," added Sudeep. "If Hindi is not our national language then why do you release your mother tongue movies by dubbing them in Hindi?" Ajay had tweeted in Hindi.
title: The man I know would never tweet in Hindi: Sudeep on debate with Ajay

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck, who recently tied the knot, were emotional during their wedding, Kenosha Portis has said. Kenosha, who watched the ceremony, said, "It was so exciting...I'm like, 'Oh my god, this is Jennifer Lopez we're getting ready to marry'." Kenosha added the duo cried during the wedding and the couple's children "were right there behind them".
title: Jennifer, Affleck were emotional at their wedding; they cried: Witness

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Actress Mallika Sherawat said some people tried to "shoot her" saying she is "spoiling" Indian culture. "I was an easy target because I had no support in Bollywood...Mahesh Bhatt once told me, 'You keep on falling and crying, so some people in Bollywood enjoy that'," added Mallika. Mallika stated her glamour was too much to handle for Indian women.
title: Some people tried to shoot me saying I'm spoiling Indian culture: Mallika

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actress Ananya Panday has revealed that she has been a fan of actress Alia Bhatt "all along". "I love her work...I love her spirit. I'm always looking forward to her work," she added. Speaking about Alia, Ananya further said, "There's so much she packs in, with so much nuance and novelty....she has some amazing pieces of work to her credit."
title: I love Alia Bhatt's work & her spirit, I look forward to her work: Ananya

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Filmmaker Joe Russo has arrived in Mumbai ahead of the premiere of his upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. Pictures of 'The Gray Man' co-director Joe Russo have surfaced as he was spotted at the Kalina airport in Mumbai. Dhanush, who is part of the film, also arrived in Mumbai. Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans star in the film.
title: Joe Russo arrives in Mumbai ahead of 'The Gray Man' premiere, pics surface

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Producer DVV Danayya, who also produced SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', has said that his upcoming project with actor Prabhas will go on the floors in September. He further revealed that the film will completely be shot in India and the process of casting the leading lady for the film is going on. The film will be a supernatural action thriller.
title: Film with Prabhas will go on the floors in September: 'RRR' producer

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Discussing the film 'Partner' where he starred with actor Salman Khan, actor Govinda said, "Once I was leaving the set and randomly...told Salman...'You won't look back after this film', and that's...what happened." "Salman and I...have a love-hate relationship," Govinda had said, discussing their relationship. Salman had shared that he was "very scared" to act with Govinda at one point.
title: Told Salman 'You won't look back after this film': Govinda on 'Partner'

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he is done being the "Harry Potter" of Bollywood. "I've done the coming of age [films], I have come off age," added Ranbir. Discussing his upcoming film 'Shamshera', Ranbir had said, "It was extremely hard. There were many days when I had given up...I used to go home and speak to Alia Bhatt about it."
title: I am done being the 'Harry Potter' of Bollywood: Actor Ranbir Kapoor

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Fans of actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will be seen in the film 'Liger' and starred in the movie 'Arjun Reddy', reportedly erected a 75-feet banner where the actor can be seen shirtless, at Sudarshan 35MM theatre in Hyderabad. The banner has been put for the trailer launch of 'Liger' which will take place tomorrow. 'Liger' marks Vijay's first Bollywood film.
title: Fans erect 75-feet banner of 'Liger' actor Vijay Deverakonda in Hyderabad

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actress Mallika Sherawat revealed she was offered Tesher and Jason Derulo's song 'Jalebi Baby'. "They called me...asked me if I can do this song...I told them, don't call...and get lost. I cut the call then," she stated. Mallika added she was called 'Jalebi Baby' on the US streets and that's when her manager told her the song was a hit.
title: Told them to get lost: Mallika Sherawat on being offered 'Jalebi Baby'

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that it's important for any profession to keep friendship and work separate. "I have seen it with my father (late actor Rishi Kapoor), that actors do film for their friends and that only breaks the friendship," he stated. Ranbir added, "For me, when I work, I prefer working...not socialising, so I like to be detached."
title: When actor does film for his friends, it only breaks friendship: Ranbir

author: Amartya Sharma
content: Actor Fahadh Faasil has said there was no part one or part two when the film 'Pushpa' was offered to him. He added filmmaker Sukumar had originally planned the film to be an OTT series on red sandalwood. "Recently when I spoke with him, he said we have scope for 'Pushpa 3' also. We have so much material," he added.
title: Director Sukumar said we have scope for 'Pushpa 3': Fahadh Faasil

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Ex-Indian cricketers Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan Singh and Suresh Raina have been reportedly approached to participate in the tenth season of the reality dance show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. Ex-Sri Lankan player Lasith Malinga has also been approached, the reports added. A source informed ETimes TV that there are high chances of Yuvraj doing the show and will soon sign the deal.
title: Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan approached for 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10': Reports
